title: Using 3D X-ray Microscopy to Understand the Driving Force for Grain Boundary Migration in Polycrystals
content: The conventional theory for grain growth asserts that curvature is principal driving force for grain boundary migration. However, high energy X-ray diffraction microscopy (HEDM) has recently been used to measure both the curvature and velocity of individual grain boundaries in polycrystalline Ni [1], SrTiO3 [2], and Î±-Fe [3] during grain growth. Surprisingly, no correlation is found between the measured velocity and curvature.
